chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

transliteration: âThe Messenger of Allah (saw) said: 'When any one of you goes to defecate, let him not face toward the Qiblah, rather let him face toward the east or the west.'â (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification
transliteration: âThe Messenger of Allah (saw) passed by two graves and said: 'These two are being punished, but they are not being punished for something that was difficult to avoid. He said: 'Perhaps the torment will be reduced for them as long as this does not dry out.'â (Sahih)  Mansur contradicted him, he reported it from Mujahid and from Ibn Abbas, but he did not mention Tawus in it.

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification
transliteration: that the Messenger of Allah (saw) forbade urinating into standing water.

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification
transliteration: that the Prophet (saw) said: âNone of you should urinate in the place where he bathes, for most Waswasa (devilish whispers) come from that. (Hasan)

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification
transliteration: âA man passed by the Prophet (saw) when he was urinating and greeted him with Salam, but he did not return his greeting.â (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification
transliteration: from his father, that the Prophet (saw) forbade breathing into the vessel (when drinking), touching one's penis with one's right hand, and cleaning oneself with one's right hand. (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification
transliteration: âI heard the Messenger of Allah (saw) offering the (funeral) prayer for one who had died, and I heard him say in his supplication: 'Allahummaghfir lahu warhamhu wa 'afihi wa a'fu 'anhu wa akrim nuzulahu wa wassi' madkhalahu waghsilhu bil-ma'i wath-thalji wal-baradi wa naqqihi min al-khataya kama ynaqqath-thawb al-abyad min ad-danas. (O Allah, forgive him and have mercy on him, keep him safe and sound and forgive him, honor the place where he settles and make his entrance wide; wash him with water and snow and hail, and cleanse him of sin as a white garment is cleansed of dirt).â (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification
transliteration: âWe were with the Prophet (saw) on a journey, and he tapped me on the back with a stick he had with him, then he turned off (route) and I turned off with him until he came to such and such an area. Then he made his camel stop and went away until he came back and said: 'Do you have water with you?' I had a water skin with me, so I brought it out and poured it for him. He washed his hands and face and began to wash his arms, but he was wearing a Syrian Jubbah that had narrow sleeves, so he brought his arms out beneath the Jubbah and washed his hands and arms, and wiped his forelock a little and his turban a little.â - Ibn Awn said: âI cannot remember it well - then he wiped over his Khuffs.â Then he said: 'What do you need?' I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, I do not need anything.' Then we came and Abdur-Rahman bin Awf was leading the people in Salah, and he had led them in one Rakah of the Subh (Fajr) prayer. chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification
transliteration: It was narrated from (Aws bin) Abi Aws that his grandfather said: âI saw the Messenger of Allah (saw) trickle water into his hand until it started to drip from his hand, three times.â (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification
transliteration: âI saw Uthman bin Affan, may Allah be pleased with him, performing Wudu. He poured water on his hands three times and washed them, then he rinsed his mouth and his nose, then he washed his face three times, then he washed right arm to the elbow three times, then the left likewise. Then he wiped his head, then he washed his right foot three times, then the left likewise. Then he said: 'I saw the Messenger of Allah (saw) performing Wudu like I have just done. Then he said: 'Whoever performs Wudu as I have done, then prays two Rak'ahs without letting his thoughts wander, his previous sins will be forgiven.'â (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification
transliteration: âAbdullah told us: âThe Messenger of Allah (saw) was praying at the House (the Kabah) and a group of the nobles of Quraish were sitting there. chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification
transliteration: âWe went out with the Messenger of Allah (saw) on one of his journeys, and when we were in Al-Baidaâ or Dhat Al-Jaish, a necklace of mine broke and fell. The Messenger of Allah (saw) stayed there looking for it and the people stayed with him. There was no water near them, and they did not have water with them. The people came to Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with him, and said: âDo you see what Aisha has done? She has made the Messenger of Allah (saw) and the people stop and they are not near any water and they do not have water with them.â Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with him, came while the Messenger of Allah (saw) was resting his head on my thigh and had gone to sleep. The Messenger of Allah (saw) slept until morning when he woke up without any water. Then Allah, the Mighty and Sublime revealed the verse of Tayammum. Usaid bin Hudair said: âThis is not the first time we have been blessed because of you, O family of Abu Bakr!ââ She said: âThen we made the camel that I had been riding stand up, and we found the necklace beneath it.â (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification
transliteration: âThe Messenger of Allah (saw) stopped to rest at the end of the night in Uwlat Al-Jaish. His wife Aisha was with him and her necklace of Zifar beads* broke and fell. The army was detained looking for that necklace of hers until the break of the light of dawn and the people had no water with them. Abu Bakr got angry with her and said: âYou have detained the people and they do not have any water.â Then Allah the Mighty and Sublime revealed the concession allowing Tayammum with clean earth. So the Muslims got up with the Messenger of Allah (saw) and struck the earth with their hands and did not strike them together to knock off any of the dust, then they wiped their faces and arms up to the shoulders, and from the inner side of their arms up to the armpits.â (Sahih)  *Black and white Yemeni beads.

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification
transliteration: âWe were with Umar when a man came to him and said: âO Commander of the Believers! Sometimes we stay for a month or two without finding any water. chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 1, Book of The Book of Purification

chapter: Chapter no: 5, Book of The Book of Salah
transliteration: from Malik bin Saâsaâah, that the Prophet (saw) said: âWhile I was at the Kabah, in a state between sleep and wakefulness, three men came, and one of them who was in the middle came toward me. I was brought a basin of gold, filled with wisdom and faith, and he slit open from the throat to the lower abdomen, and washed the heart with Zamzam water, then - âit was filled with wisdom and faith. Then I was brought a riding-beast, smaller than a mule and bigger than a donkey. I set off with Jibril, peace be upon him, and we came to the lowest heaven. It was said: âWho is this?â He said: âJibril.â It was said: âWho is with you?â He said: âMuhammad (SAW).â It was said: âHas (revelation) been sent to him? Welcome to him, what an excellent visit his is.â I came to Adam, peace be upon him, and greeted him, and he said: âWelcome to you! What an excellent son and Prophet.â Then we came to the second heaven and it was said: âWho is this?â He said: âJibrail.â* It was said: âWho is with you?â He said: âMuhammad (SAW).â And the same exchange took place. I came to Yahya and Eisa, peace be upon them both, and greeted them, and they said: âWelcome to you! What an excellent brother and Prophet.â Then we came to the third heaven and it was said: âWho is this?â He said: âJibrail.â It was said: âWho is with you?â He said: âMuhammad (SAW).â And the same exchange took place. I came to Yusuf, peace be upon him, and greeted him, and he said: âWelcome to you! What an excellent brother and Prophet.â Then we came to the fourth heaven and the same exchange took place. I came to Eidris, peace be upon him, and greeted him, and he said: âWelcome to you! What an excellent brother and Prophet.â Then we came to the fifth heaven and the same exchange took place. I came to Harun, peace be upon him, and greeted him, and he said: âWelcome to you! What an excellent brother and Prophet.â Then we came to the sixth heaven and the same exchange took place. I came to Musa, peace be upon him, and greeted him, and he said: âWelcome to you! What an excellent brother and Prophet.â When I passed him, he wept, and it was said: âWhy are you weeping?â He said: âO Lord, this young man whom You have sent after me, more of his Ummah will enter Paradise than from my nation, and they will be more virtuous than them.â Then we came to the seventh heaven and a similar exchange took place. I came to Ibrahim, peace be upon him, and greeted him, and he said: âWelcome to you! What an excellent son and Prophet.â Then I was taken up to the Oft-Frequented House (Al-Bait al-Mamur) and I asked Jibrail about it, and he said: âThis is Al-Bait al-Mamur in which seventy thousand angels pray every day, and when they leave it they never come back.â Then I was taken up to Sidrah Al-Muntaha (the Lote-Tree of the Utmost Boundary). Its fruits were like the Qilal** of Hajar and its leaves were like the ears of elephants. At its base were four rivers: Two hidden rivers and two manifest rivers. I asked Jibrail (about them) and he said: âThe two hidden ones are in Paradise, and the two manifest ones are the Euphrates and the Nile.â Then fifty prayers were enjoined on me. I came to Musa and he said: âWhat happened?â I said: âFifty prayers have been enjoined upon me.â He said: âI know more about the people than you. I tried hard with the Children of Israel. Your Ummah will never be able to bear that. Go back to your Lord and ask Him to reduce it for you.â So I went back to my Lord and asked Him to reduce it, and He made it forty. Then I went back to Musa, peace be upon him, and he said: âWhat happened?â I said: âHe made it forty.â He said to me something similar to what he said the first time, so I went back to my Lord and He made it thirty. I came to Musa, peace be upon him, and he said something similar to what he said the first time, so I went back to my Lord and He made it twenty, then ten, then five. I came to Musa, peace be upon him, and he said to me something like he had said the first time, but I said: âI feel too shy before my Lord to go back to Him.â Then it was called out: âI have decreed (the reward for) My obligation, and I have reduced the burden for My slaves, and I will give ten-fold reward for each good deed.ââ  *It is like this here, while it is Jibrail the first time it appears in this narration, and Jibrail is often used in the Hadith literature.   **Plural of Qullah. [As explained under Hadith no. 52: It comes with some explanation in Sunan At-Tirmidhi: Abdah (one of the narrators) said: âMuhammad (SAW) bin Ishaq said: âA Qullah refers to Jirar (These are two nouns describing large casks that are used to hold water), and a Qullah is the thing that drinking water is held in.ââ At-Tirmidhi said: âThis is the saying of Ash-Shafii, Ahmad and Ishaq. They say that when the water is two Qullahs then nothing makes it impure, as long as it does not change its smell, and its taste. And they say, it is approximately fifty Qirbahs (waterskins).â]

chapter: Chapter no: 5, Book of The Book of Salah
chain_of_narration: Anas bin Malik and Ibn Hazm
transliteration: âThe Messenger of Allah (saw) said: âAllah, the Mighty and Sublime, enjoined fifty prayers upon my Ummah, and I came back with that until I passed by Musa, peace be upon him, who said: âWhat has your Lord enjoined upon your Ummah?â I said: âHe has enjoined fifty prayers on them.â Musa said to me: âGo back to your Lord, the Mighty and Sublime, for your Ummah will not be able to do that.â So I went back to my Lord, the Mighty and Sublime, and He reduced a portion of it. Then I came back to Musa and told him, and he said: âGo back to your Lord, for your Ummah will not be able to do that.â So I went back to my Lord, the Mighty and Sublime, and He said: âThey are five (prayers) but they are fifty (in reward), and the Word that comes from Me cannot be changed.â [50:29] I came back to Musa and he said: âGo back to your Lord.â I said: âI feel too shy before my Lord, the Mighty and Sublime.ââ (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 5, Book of The Book of Salah
transliteration: that the Messenger of Allah (saw) said: âI was brought an animal that was larger than a donkey and smaller than a mule, whose stride could reach as far as it could see. I mounted it, and Jibril was with me, and I set off. Then he said: âDismount and pray,â so I did that. He said: âDo you know where you have prayed? You have prayed in Taibah, which will be the place of the emigration.â Then he said: âDismount and pray,â so I prayed. He said: âDo you know where you have prayed? You have prayed in Mount Sinai, where Allah, the Mighty and Sublime, spoke to Musa, peace be upon him.â Then he said: âDismount and pray.â So I dismounted and prayed, and he said: âDo you know where you have prayed? You have prayed in Bethlehem, where âEisa, peace be upon him, was born.â Then I entered Bait Al-Maqdis (Jerusalem) where the Prophets, peace be upon them, were assembled for me, and Jibrail brought me forward to lead them in prayer. Then I was taken up to the first heaven, where I saw Adam, peace be upon him. Then I was taken up to the second heaven where I saw the maternal cousins âEisa and Yahya, peace be upon them. Then I was taken up to the third heaven where I saw Yusuf, peace be upon him. Then I was taken up to the fourth heaven where I saw Harun, peace be upon him. Then I was taken up to the fifth heaven where I saw Eidris, peace be upon him. Then I was taken up to the sixth heaven where I saw Musa, peace be upon him. Then I was taken up to the seventh heaven where I saw Ibrahim, peace be upon him. Then I was taken up above the seven heavens and we came to Sidrah Al-Muntaha and I was covered with fog. I fell down prostrate and it was said to me: â(Indeed) The day I created the heavens and the Earth, I enjoined upon you and your Ummah fifty prayers, so establish them, you and your Ummah.â I came back to Ibrahim and he did not ask me about anything, then I came to Musa and he said: âHow much did your Lord enjoin upon you and your Ummah?â I said: âFifty prayers.â He said: âYou will not be able to establish them, neither you nor your Ummah. Go back to your Lord and ask Him to reduce it.â So I went back to my Lord and He reduced by ten. Then I came to Musa and he told me to go back, so I went back and He reduced it by ten. Then I came back to Musa and he told me to go back, so I went back and He reduced it by ten. Then it was reduced to five prayers. He (Musa) said: âGo back to your Lord and ask Him to reduce it, for two prayers were enjoined upon the Children of Israel but they did not establish them.â So I went back to my Lord and asked Him to reduce it, but He said: âThe day I created the heavens and the Earth, I enjoined fifty prayers upon you and your Ummah. Five is for fifty, so establish them, you and your Ummah.â I knew that this was what Allah, the Mighty and Sublime, had determined so I went back to Musa, peace be upon him, and he said: âGo back.â But I knew that it was what Allah had determined, so I did not go back.â (Hasan)

chapter: Chapter no: 6, Book of The Book of the Times (of Prayer)

chapter: Chapter no: 6, Book of The Book of the Times (of Prayer)
transliteration: that Jibrail came to the Prophet (saw) to teach him the times of prayer. Jibrail went forward, with the Messenger of Allah (saw) behind him and the people behind the Messenger of Allah (saw), and he prayed Zuhr when the sun had passed its zenith. Then he came to him when the shadow of a person was equal to his height, and did as he had done before; Jibrail went forward, with the Messenger of Allah (saw) behind him and the people behind the Messenger of Allah (saw), and he prayed Asr. Then Jibrail came to him when the sun had set; Jibrail went forward, with the Messenger of Allah (saw) behind him and the people behind the Messenger of Allah (saw), and he prayed Maghrib. Then he came to him when the twilight had disappeared; Jibrail went forward, with the Messenger of Allah (saw) behind him and the people behind the Messenger of Allah (saw), and he prayed Isha. Then he came to him when dawn broke; Jibrail went forward, with the Messenger of Allah (saw) behind him and the people behind the Messenger of Allah (saw), and he prayed Al-Ghadah.* Then he came to him on the second day when a manâs shadow was equal to his height, and did as he had done the day before, he prayed Zuhr. Then he came to him when the shadow of a man was twice his height, and did what he had done the day before, and prayed Asr. Then he came to him when the sun had set and did what he had done the day before, and prayed Maghrib. Then we slept and got up, and slept and got up again. Then he came to him and did what he had done the day before and prayed Isha. Then he came to him when the (light of) dawn was spread (on the horizon)** and the stars were still clear in the sky, and he did the same as he had done the day before, and prayed Al-Ghadah. Then he said: âThe time between these two is the time for prayer.ââ (Sahih)  *Meaning Fajr, the morning prayer.  **The Fajr prayer was elongated because the Prophet (saw) recited at length during the prayer, so that it ended just before sunrise. That defined the end of the time for Fajr, as the beginning of the time was defined by the moment when he started the first Rakah.

chapter: Chapter no: 6, Book of The Book of the Times (of Prayer)

chapter: Chapter no: 6, Book of The Book of the Times (of Prayer)

(Hasan)

transliteration: that while the Messenger of Allah (saw) was sitting in the row for prayer. The Hadith.* (Sahih)  *With this chain, At-Tirmidhi recorded it (No. 302) and An-Nasai in Al-Kubra (No. 1631). It is the narration about the man who prayed incorrectly, and in it, the Prophet (saw) instructed him: âThen Tashhad, then say the Iqamah.â And they say that the meaning of Tashhad here is call the Adhan. An-Nasai recorded the hadith with different chains (1054, 1137, 1314,1315). Whereas the wording narrated by At-Tirmidhi, and the author in Al-Kubra, mentions what the author mentioned in the chapter, the other cited versions that An-Nasai in this book quoted do not. So it is as if he narrated the chain here for Hadith, indicating the same version that At-Tirmidhi narrated, and he himself in Al-Kubra, but he did not was to narrate the actual text here. Abu Dawud also narrated it with the order for the Adhan and Iqamah, through a different route of transmission (No. 861). And it is among the proofs used for the view that the Adhan and Iqamah are obligatory - since it has been ordered in the Hadith of the one who prayed incorrectly.

transliteration: that the Prophet (saw) said: âWhen a man goes out of his house to his Masjid, one foot records a good deed and the other erases a bad deed.â (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: that his father said: âThe Messenger of Allah (saw) said: âWhen the wife of any one of you asks for permission to go to the Masjid, do not stop her.ââ (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: âThe Messenger of Allah (saw) said: âWhoever eats of this plantâ - the first time he said âgarlicâ then he said, âgarlic, onions and leeksâ* - âlet him not approach us in our Masjids, for the angels are offended by that which offends mankind.ââ (Sahih)  *In Fath Al-Bari, Ibn Hajar is of the opinion that it was Ibn Juraij who was talking, explaining that Ata - who reported it from Jabir - narrated it both ways.

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: Umar bin Al-Khattab said: âO people, you eat of two plants which I do not think are anything but bad, this onion and garlic. chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: âWhen the Messenger of Allah (saw) wanted to observe Itikaf, he would pray Fajr then enter the place where he wanted to observe Itikaf. He wanted to observe Itikaf during the last ten days of Ramadan, so he commanded that a Khiba (tent) be pitched for him. When the Messenger of Allah (saw) saw that he said: âIs it righteousness that you seek?â And he did not observe Itikaf in Ramadan, and observed Itikaf for ten days in Shawwal (instead).â (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: âSad was wounded on the day of Al-Khandaq when a man of Quraish shot him in the medial arm vein. The Messenger of Allah (saw) pitched a tent (Khaimah) for him in the Masjid so that he could visit him close at hand.â (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: that he heard Abu Qatadah say: âWhile we were sitting in the Masjid, the Messenger of Allah (saw) came out to us carrying Umamah bint Abi Al-As bin Ar-Rabi, whose mother was Zainab, the daughter of the Messenger of Allah (saw). She was a little girl and he was carrying her. The Messenger of Allah (saw) prayed with her on his shoulder, putting her down when he bowed and picking her up again when he stood up, until he completed his prayer.â (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: that he heard Abu Hurairah say: âThe Messenger of Allah (saw) sent some horsemen toward Najd, and they brought back a man from Banu Hanifah who was called Thumamah bin Uthal, the chief of the people of Al-Yamamah. Then he was tied to one of the pillars of the Masjid.â (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: that the Messenger of Allah (saw) performed Tawaf during the Farewell Pilgrimage atop a camel, touching the Rukn* with a stick that was bent at the top. (Sahih)  *The corner of the Kabah in which the Black Stone is situated.

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: from his father, from his grandfather, that the Prophet (saw) forbade sitting in circles on Friday before Jumuah prayer, and buying and selling in the Masjid. (Hasan)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: from his father, from his grandfather, that the Prophet (saw) forbade reciting poetry in the Masjid. (Hasan)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: âUmar passed by Hassan bin Thabit while he was reciting poetry in the Masjid, and glared at him. He said: âI recited poetry when there was someone better than you in the Masjid.â Then he turned to Abu Hurairah and said: âDid you not hear the Messenger of Allah (saw) when he said: âAnswer back on my behalf. O Allah, help him with the Holy Spirit!ââ He said: âYes, by Allah.ââ (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: âA man came making announcement of a lost camel in the Masjid, and the Messenger of Allah (saw) said: âMay you never find it!ââ (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: âI said to Amr: âDid you hear Jabir say: âA man passed through the Masjid carrying arrows, and the Messenger of Allah (saw) said to him: âHold them by the blades?ââ He said: âYes.ââ (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: âAlqamah and I entered upon Abdullah bin Masud and he said to us: âHave these people prayed?â We said: âNo.â He said: âGet up and pray.â So we went to stand behind him, and he put one of us on his right and the other on his left, and he prayed with no Adhan and no Iqamah. When he bowed he interlaced his fingers and placed his hands between his knees, and he said: âI saw the Messenger of Allah (saw) doing that.ââ (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: âI heard Ibrahim (narrate) from Alqamah and Al-Aswad from Abdullah,â and he narrated something similar. (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: from his paternal uncle, that he saw the Messenger of Allah (saw) lying on his back in the Masjid, placing one leg on top of the other. (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: that when he was young and single, with no family, at the time of the Messenger of Allah (saw), he used to sleep in the Masjid of the Prophet (saw). (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: âThe Messenger of Allah (saw) said: âSpitting in the Masjid is a sin, and its expiation is to bury it.ââ (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: that the Messenger of Allah (saw) saw some sputum on the Qiblah wall. He scrapped it off then he turned to the people and said: âWhen any one of you is praying, let him not spit in front of him, for Allah is in front of him when he prays.â (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: that the Prophet (saw) saw some spittle in the Qiblah of the Masjid. He scratched it off with a pebble and forbade a man to spit to his front or to his right. He said: âLet him spit to his left or beneath his left foot.â (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: âThe Messenger of Allah (saw) said: âWhen you are praying, do not spit to the front or to your right. Spit behind you or to your left if there is no one there, otherwise do this.â And he spat beneath his foot and rubbed it.ââ (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: that his father said: âI saw the Messenger of Allah (saw) spit and then rub it with his left foot.â (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: âThe Messenger of Allah (saw) saw some sputum in the Qiblah of the Masjid, and he became so angry that his face turned red. chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: âI heard Abu Humaid and Abu Usaid say: âThe Messenger of Allah (saw) said: âWhen any one of you enters the Masjid, let him say: âAllahumma aftahli abwaba rahmatik (O Allah, open to me the gates of Your mercy). chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: that the Messenger of Allah (saw) said: âWhen any one of you enters the Masjid, let him pray two Rakahs before he sits down.â (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: âI heard Kab bin Malik telling the story of when he stayed behind from going out on the campaign of Tabuk with the Messenger of Allah (saw). He said: âThe Messenger of Allah (saw) came back in the morning, and when he came back from a journey he would go to the Masjid first and pray two Rakahs there, then he would sit to (meet with) the people. When he did that, those who had stayed behind came to him and started giving their excuses, swearing by Allah. There were eighty-odd men, and the Messenger of Allah (saw) accepted what they declared and accepted their oaths of allegiance; he prayed for forgiveness for them and left whatever was in their hearts to Allah. Then when I came and greeted him, he smiled as one who is angry, then he said: âCome here.â So I came and sat in front of him,* and he said: âWhat kept you behind? Did you not buy a mount?â I said: âO Messenger of Allah, if I were to sit before anyone other than you of those who hold high positions in this world, I would find a way to avoid his anger. I am an eloquent man but, by Allah, I know that if I were to tell you a lie today to make you pleased with me, Allah would soon make you angry with me, but if I tell you the truth, it will make you angry with me, but I will still have hope that Allah may forgive me. I have never been in a better position, physically or financially, than the time when I stayed behind and did not join you.â The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: âThis man has spoken the truth. Go away until Allah decides concerning you.â So I got up and went away.â This is an abridged version of narration. (Sahih)  *It is this which the author cites the narration for. While the absence of the mention of a thing - in this case prayer - is not a proof that it does not exist.

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: âWe used to go to the marketplace in the morning at the time of the Messenger of Allah (saw), and we would pass through the Masjid and pray there.â (Daif)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: that the Messenger of Allah (saw) said: âThe angels send Salah upon any one of you so long as he is in the place where he prays, and so long as he does no invalidate his ablution, (saying): âO Allah, forgive him, O Allah, have mercy on him.ââ (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: âI heard the Messenger of Allah (saw) say: âWhoever is in the Masjid waiting for the prayer, he is in a state of prayer.ââ (Hasan)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: that the Messenger of Allah (saw) forbade praying in the camel pens. (Hasan)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: âThe Messenger of Allah (saw) said: âThe earth has been made for me a place of prostration and a means of purification, so wherever a man of my Ummah is when the time for prayer comes, let him pray.ââ (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: that the Messenger of Allah (saw) used to pray on a mat. (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids

He said: âBy Allah, I know what it is made of. I saw it the first day it was set up and the first day the Messenger of Allah (saw) sat on it. The Messenger of Allah (saw) sent word to so-and-soâ - a woman whose name is Sahl mentioned - âtelling her: âTell your carpenter slave to make me something of wood that I can sit on when I speak to the people.â So she told him, and he made it from tamarisk wood from Al-Ghabah (a place near Al-Madinah). Then I saw the Messenger of Allah (saw) ascend it and praying on it, and saying the Takbir while he was not top of it, then he bowed when he was on top of it, then he came back downward and prostrated at the base of the Minbar, then he went back. chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: âI saw the Messenger of Allah (saw) praying on a donkey, when he was heading toward Khaibar.â (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 8, Book of The Book of the Masjids
transliteration: that he saw the Messenger of Allah (saw) praying on a donkey while he was riding, praying toward Khaibar with the Qiblah behind him.  Abu Abdur-Rahman (An-Nasai) said: We do not know of anyone who reported anything to support what Amr bin Yahya said about praying on a donkey. chapter: Chapter no: 9, Book of The Book of the Qiblah

chapter: Chapter no: 9, Book of The Book of the Qiblah
transliteration: âThe Messenger of Allah (saw) used to pray atop his mount while traveling, facing whatever direction it was facing.â  (One of the narrators) Malik said: âAbdullah bin Dinar said: And Ibn Umar used to do likewise.ââ (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 9, Book of The Book of the Qiblah

chapter: Chapter no: 9, Book of The Book of the Qiblah

chapter: Chapter no: 9, Book of The Book of the Qiblah

transliteration: âAl-Fadl and I came riding a female donkey of ours, and the Messenger of Allah (saw) was leading the people in prayer at Arafah.â Then he said something to that effect. âWe passed by part of the row, then we dismounted and left the donkey grazing, and the Messenger of Allah(saw) did not say anything to us.â (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 9, Book of The Book of the Qiblah
transliteration: âI heard Ibn Abbas narrate that he passed in front of the Messenger of Allah (saw), he and a young boy of Banu Hashim, riding a donkey in front of the Messenger of Allah (saw) when he was praying. transliteration: âI was in front of the Messenger of Allah (saw) when he was praying, and when I wanted to leave I did not want to get up and pass in front of him, so I just slipped away slowly and quietly.â* (Sahih)  *See 508 and 511 of Al-Bukhari where he uses these narrations to prove what one may use for a Sutrah. transliteration: from his father, that his grandfather said: âI saw the Messenger of Allah (saw) circumambulate the House seven times, then he prayed two Rakahs at the edge of the Maqam, and there was nothing between him and the people who were performing Tawaf.â (Daif)

chapter: Chapter no: 9, Book of The Book of the Qiblah
transliteration: âThe Messenger of Allah (saw) used to pray at night while I was lying down sleeping between him and the Qiblah on his bed. When he wanted to pray Witr he would wake me up and I would pray Witr.â (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 9, Book of The Book of the Qiblah
transliteration: âThe Messenger of Allah (saw) said: âDo not pray toward graves and do not sit on them.ââ (Sahih)

transliteration: âIn my house there was a cloth on which there were images, which I covered a closet which is in the house, and the Messenger of Allah (saw) used to pray toward it. Then he said: âO Aishah, take it away from me.â So I removed it and made pillows out of it.â (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 9, Book of The Book of the Qiblah

transliteration: âSome men used to pray with the Messenger of Allah (saw) tying their lower garments tight like children, and it was said to the women: âDo not raise your heads until the men have sat up completely.ââ (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 9, Book of The Book of the Qiblah

chapter: Chapter no: 9, Book of The Book of the Qiblah

chapter: Chapter no: 9, Book of The Book of the Qiblah
transliteration: (whose name was Saeed bin Yazid, a trustworthy Basri)  told us: âI asked Anas bin Malik: âDid the Prophet (saw) pray in sandals?â He said: âYes.ââ (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 9, Book of The Book of the Qiblah

chapter: Chapter no: 10, Book of The Book of Leading the Prayer (Al-Imamah)
transliteration: âWhen the Messenger of Allah (saw) passed away, the Ansar said: âLet there be an Amir from among us and an Amir from among you.â Then Umar came to them and said: âDo you not know that the Messenger of Allah (saw) commanded Abu Bakr to lead the people in prayer? chapter: Chapter no: 10, Book of The Book of Leading the Prayer (Al-Imamah)

chapter: Chapter no: 10, Book of The Book of Leading the Prayer (Al-Imamah)
transliteration: Sad that the Messenger of Allah (saw) heard that there was a dispute among Banu Amr bin Awf, so he went to them with some other people to reconcile between them. The Messenger of Allah (saw) was delayed there, and the time for Zuhr came. Bilal came to Abu Bakr and said to him: âThe Messenger of Allah (saw) has been delayed (there) and the time for prayer has come, will you lead the people in prayer?â Abu Bakr said: âYes, if you wish.â Bilal said the Iqamah and Abu Bakr went forward and said the Takbir for the people.* Then the Messenger of Allah (saw) came, passing through the rows (of praying people) and stood in the (first) row and the people started clapping. Abu Bakr would never glance sideways in his prayer but when the people clapped so much he looked back and (saw) the Messenger of Allah (saw). The Messenger of Allah (saw) gestured to him to carry on praying. Abu Bakr raised his hands praising Allah the Mighty and Sublime, and retreated till he reached the (first) row. Then the Messenger of Allah (saw) went forward and led the people in the prayer. When he completed the prayer he turned to face the people and said: âO people, why did you start clapping when something unusual happened to you in the prayer? Clapping is only for women. So whoever among you comes across something in the prayer should say: âSubhan Allahâ for there is none who will not turn round when they hear him saying Subhan Allah. O Abu Bakr! What prevented you from leading the people in the prayer when I gestured you to do so?â Abu Bakr replied: âIt is not fitting for the son of Abu Quhafah to lead the prayer in the presence of the Messenger of Allah (saw).ââ (Sahih)  *That is, he started the prayer for the congregation.

chapter: Chapter no: 10, Book of The Book of Leading the Prayer (Al-Imamah)
transliteration: âThere was some fighting among Banu Amr bin Awf, and news of that reached the Prophet (saw). He prayed Zuhr, then he went to them to reconcile between them. Then he said to Bilal: âO Bilal, if the time for Asr comes and I have not come back, then tell Abu Bakr to lead the people in prayer.â When the time (for Asr) came, Bilal called the Adhan, then the Iqamah, then he said to Abu Bakr: âGo forward.â So Abu Bakr went forward and started to pray. Then the Messenger of Allah (saw) came and started passing through the rows of people until he stood behind Abu Bakr, and the people clapped. Abu Bakr was such that whenever he started praying, he would never glance sideways, but when he noticed that the clapping persisted he turned around. The Messenger of Allah (saw) gestured to him to carry on praying. Abu Bakr praised Allah the Mighty and Sublime for the Messenger of Allah (saw) having told him to continue. Then Abu Bakr moved backward on his heels, and when the Messenger of Allah (saw) saw that, he came forward and led the people in prayer. When he completed the prayer he said: âO Abu Bakr, when I gestured to you, what kept you from continuing (to lead the people)?â He said: âIt does not befit the son of Abu Quhafah to lead the Messenger of Allah (saw) in prayer.â And he (the Prophet (saw)) said to the people: âIf you notice something (during the prayer), men should say Subhan Allah and women should clap.ââ (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 10, Book of The Book of Leading the Prayer (Al-Imamah)

chapter: Chapter no: 10, Book of The Book of Leading the Prayer (Al-Imamah)
transliteration: âI entered upon Aishah and said: âWill you not tell me about the sickness of the Messenger of Allah (saw)?â She said: âWhen the Messenger of Allah (saw) became seriously ill, he said: âHave the people prayed?â We said: âNo, they are waiting for you, O Messenger of Allah.â He said: âPut some water in a tub for me.â We did that and he performed Ghusl, then he tried to get up but he fainted. Then for the third time he said the same thing. She said: The people were in the Masjid, waiting for the Messenger of Allah (saw) to lead the Isha prayer. The Messenger of Allah (saw) sent word to Abu Bakr, telling him to lead the people in prayer, so the messenger came to him and said: âThe Messenger of Allah (saw) is telling you to lead the people in prayer.â Abu Bakr was a tender-hearted man, so he said: âO Umar, lead the people in prayer.â But (Umar) said: âYou have more right to that.â So Abu Bakr led them in prayer during those days. When the Messenger of Allah (saw) felt a little better, he came with the help of two men, one of whom was Al-Abbas, to pray Zuhr. When Abu Bakr saw him, he wanted to step back, but the Messenger of Allah (saw) gestured to him not to step back. He told them (the two men) to seat him beside him, and Abu Bakr started to pray standing, and the people were following the prayer of Abu Bakr, and the Messenger of Allah (saw) was praying sitting.ââ  âI (Ubaidullah) entered upon Ibn Abbas and said: âShall I not tell you what Aishah narrated to me about the sickness of the Messenger of Allah (saw)?â He said: âYes.â So I told him and he did not deny any of it, but he said: âDid she tell you the name of the man who was with Al-Abbas?â I said: âNo.â He said: âThat was Ali, may Allah honor his face.ââ (Sahih)

chapter: Chapter no: 10, Book of The Book of Leading the Prayer (Al-Imamah)
transliteration: âWhoever would like to meet Allah tomorrow as a Muslim, let him regularly attend these five (daily) prayers whenever the call for them is given (that in the masjid (mosque)s), for Allah prescribed for His Prophet (saw) the ways of guidance, and they (the prayers) are part of those ways of guidance.
